refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the number of channels in a sound file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the number of channels in a sound file.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ifilcod -- sound file to be queried

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: filenchnls returns the number of channels in the sound file ifilcod. filechnls can return the number of channels of convolve and PVOC files if the iallowraw flag is not zero (it is non-zero by default).

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the filenchnls opcode. It uses the file filenchnls.csd, fox.wav, and drumsSlp.wav.
Example of the filenchnls opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
The audio file fox.wav is monoaural (1 channel), while drumsSlp.wav is stereo (2 channels) So filenchnls's output should include lines like this:
number of channels = 1 number of channels = 2
